content.webTitle: Full list: Britons held at Guantanamo

fields.headline: Full list: Britons held at Guantanamo
fields.bodyText: Those whose imminent return to Britain was announced by Jack Straw today Shafiq Rasool, 24, from Tipton, West Midlands - unconfirmed reports suggested he was detained in northern Afghanistan by Northern Alliance troops. Asif Iqbal, 20, a parcel depot worker from Tipton - detained at the same time, according to reports. Ruhal Ahmed, 23, a student from Tipton - detained at the same time, according to reports. Tarek Dergoul, 24, a former care worker from east London. Jamal Al Harith,, 35, a web site designer from Manchester. Those who will continue to be detained at Guantanamo Feroz Abbasi, 23, from Croydon, south London, a former computer student, detained at Kunduz in Afghanistan, December 2001. Moazzam Begg, 36, from Sparkhill, Birmingham - arrested by the CIA in the Pakistani capital Islamabad, February 2002. Martin Mubanga, 29, from north London. Richard Belmar, 23, from London. Others Tariq Mahmood, 30, from Birmingham, was arrested in Pakistan in October on suspicion of involvement with al-Qaida and he could be the 10th Briton held at the base, but justice pressure group Fair Trial Abroad said his whereabouts were currently unknown. Two British residents are also at the base. Bisher al-Rawi, an Iraqi national, lived in Kingston upon Thames, and was granted indefinite leave to remain in the UK more than 19 years ago. Jamil al-Banna, a Jordanian national, was granted refugee status in 2000.
